breakthroughPP.players

Class AIPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • breakthroughPP.players.AbstractPlayer
      • breakthroughPP.players.AIPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player, Setting, java.rmi.Remote

    public class AIPlayer
extends AbstractPlayer
    Implementation of an very intelligent player.

    Georg-August University Goettingen APP breakthroughPP SoSe 2016 Gr CodeSalat

    Author:
    Fabiola Buschendorf, Haseeb, Artur

      • init

        public void init(int dimX,
        int dimY,
        int color)
          throws java.lang.Exception,
                 java.rmi.RemoteException
        Initialization of board, color and probabilities
        Specified by:
        init in interface Player
        Overrides:
        init in class AbstractPlayer
        Parameters:
        dimX - width of the board in x direction
        dimY - height of the board in y direction
        color - color of the player specified in Setting or 2 this instance should show the board for both players
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection with the net fails
        PresetException - if the color of the player is not 0,1 or 2
        java.lang.Exception - if another exception occures
        See Also:
        Player

      • request

        public Move request()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Chooses the move which leads to a field with the highest value. If several fields are assigned with the same value, it chooses the first field. Due to the way validMoves are calculated this will lead to a strategy to attack over preferably one side.
        Specified by:
        request in interface Player
        Overrides:
        request in class AbstractPlayer
        Returns:
        the selected (best) move.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        java.rmi.RemoteException

        Returns:

        private Move[] canBreakthrough(Position start)
                        throws PresetException,
                               PlayerException
        Calculates a breakthrough Move 3 steps from goal.
        Parameters:
        start - the start position of my token which may breakthrough.
        Returns:
        a Move[] with the next moves to breakthrough the enemy.

      • breakthrough

        private Move[] breakthrough(Position start)
                     throws PresetException
        Constructs a move[] with connected, valid moves.
        Parameters:
        start - the start Position
        Returns:
        a move[3] array with the next moves, starting with 0, to be executed to win
        Throws:
        PresetException
